snippet: In a second “green on blue” attack, in the south, an Afghan security force member wounded two American soldiers, the latest in a spate of attacks by Afghan forces on their coalition counterparts.
abstract: Two American Special Forces members are shot to death by an Afghan local police recruit in western Afghanistan; another Afghan security force member turns his weapon on other international service personnel, wounding two American soldiers; shootings are latest in spate of attacks by Afghan forces on their coalition counterparts.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times and Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington.

lead_paragraph: In a second “green on blue” attack, in the south, an Afghan security force member wounded two American soldiers, the latest in a spate of attacks by Afghan forces on their coalition counterparts.

headline.seo: Two Americans Killed By Afghan Recruit
headline.main: Two Americans Killed by Afghan Recruit
headline.print_headline: Afghan Police Recruit Turns His Weapon on His American Trainers, Killing 2

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
